page.title: 05BURTON PIDSEA HOUSES
page.content: As part of our study of Burton Pidsea we tried to find out how old some of the houses were. Glebelands is a new estate of semi-detached houses which were built in 1970. Kissing Gate is an older road and has larger houses. Four are detached. They were built in 1927. In Church Street, the Foundry Cottage, Cross Keys Cottage and the shop are all 250 years old. But Church Cottages are only 10 years old.The original ones were demolished. Cross Keys Cottage was once the village pub. Clematis Cottage, on the Main Road, was once the Dame School. All the doors are low and small. The lounge and bedroom were classrooms. The rest was the teacher's house.
